CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper June 2, 1962, pg. 1, reads: "Break Bread Together - Pictured above are Republican leaders of Western Pennsylvania as they appeared during an unusual meeting in the banquet hall of Loendi Club last Friday evening. The event marked they first time that a Negro GOP group had sponsored candidates for statewide office. The meeting was arranged by the Western Pennsylvania Republican Committee. Seated, left to right: Burrell Haselrig, Johnstown, Pa., Atty. Wendell Freeland, William Atkins, County GOP Chairman John Walker, Congressman William Scranton, gubernatorial candidate; James Van Zandt, U. S. Senatorial candidate; Louis McTurner, chairman of the affair; W. P. Young, chairman of the committee; William Butler, Beaver County, and Quinn Banks, Washington County  - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Burrell Haselrig, Atty. Wendell Freeland, William Atkins, John Walker, Pennsylvania gubernatorial candidate William "Bill" Scranton, congressman James Van Zandt, Louis McTurner, W. P. Young, William Butler and Quinn Banks seated at table for Republican banquet at Loendi Club
